name: AWS Global Infrastructure
description: Flashcards covering AWS Global Infrastructure from AWS Cloud Technical Essentials Module 1

cards.front: Why should you upload critical files like photos to AWS instead of storing them only on your laptop?
cards.back: Uploading to AWS ensures redundant copies exist in data centers, protecting against laptop failure and enabling access from anywhere.
cards.example: I uploaded my family photos to an S3 bucket so I can view them from my phone even if my laptop crashes.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: What is an AWS data center?
cards.back: A facility containing servers, networking, and power infrastructure where AWS stores customer data and runs services.
cards.example: My photos are stored on servers in an AWS data center in Northern Virginia.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: What is an AWS Availability Zone (AZ)?
cards.back: A group of one or more data centers within a region, connected by redundant power and networking, providing high availability.
cards.example: We deployed our web servers in two AZs to stay online even if one data center has an outage.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.back: A geographic area made up of multiple Availability Zones, offering customers choice of where to host resources.
cards.example: We chose the Europe (London) region to comply with UK data residency requirements.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: What are the four main factors to consider when choosing an AWS region?
cards.back: Compliance requirements, latency to users, regional pricing, and availability of services in that region.
cards.example: We picked the Oregon region because it met our low-latency needs and offered the newest services at a good price.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: Why is compliance the first factor when selecting an AWS region?
cards.back: Regulatory or legal requirements may mandate data to remain within specific geographic boundaries.
cards.example: Our healthcare app must store patient data in the Canada Central region to meet Canadian privacy laws.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: How does latency influence AWS region choice?
cards.back: Lower latency is achieved by placing resources closer to end users, improving application responsiveness.
cards.example: We host our gaming servers in the Oregon region to minimize delay for West Coast players.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: Why can pricing vary between AWS regions?
cards.back: Different regions have varying operational costs, taxes, and demand, affecting service prices.
cards.example: Storing data in the SÃ£o Paulo region costs more than in US East due to local taxes.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: What is service availability in an AWS region?
cards.back: Not all AWS services launch in every region immediately, so you must verify needed services exist where you plan to run.
cards.example: We delayed using a new AI service until it was available in our chosen region.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: What is the AWS Global Edge Network?
cards.back: A worldwide network of Edge locations and regional Edge caches that cache content closer to users to reduce latency.
cards.example: Our website uses CloudFront to deliver images from the nearest Edge location, speeding up page loads for global visitors.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: What is an AWS Edge location?
cards.back: A site within the Global Edge Network that caches content closer to end users to speed up data delivery.
cards.example: Users in Tokyo fetch cached video segments from the Tokyo Edge location instead of Australia.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure

cards.front: How does Amazon CloudFront use the Global Edge Network?
cards.back: CloudFront distributes and caches content at Edge locations and regional caches, automatically routing user requests to the nearest site.
cards.example: We set up CloudFront for our S3 bucket, so static assets load quickly worldwide.
cards.subject: AWS Global Infrastructure
